item.title: Your terminal with Oh My Zsh, Spaceship, Dracula and more functionalities
item.description: Letting your terminal better to work Hello there. Let’s configuration a beauty and productive terminal. This is not a detailed tutorial. I will leave here links and some commands on how I set up my terminal. It’s easy, just follow in order Terminator Step by step 1. Install Zsh You need to install a different shell. But calm. Nothing will change in relation to bash Access this page. This will help you with installation for your Linux distro.

item.title: [Music] Enjoy the last working day of the week
item.description: Hi there! Today I didn’t work on any personal projects. The day was full. There are days when we need to stop, open a beer and relax. I recommend that you to do this. Enjoy a song that a frien sent me some days ago. I loved and I want to share with you. Have a good night and a great weekend! See you monday!

item.title: Starting New Project [Planning]
item.description: The Planning: I started a new project. Unnamed yet, but I already know about what will be. It looks a bit silly but I want to do a money manager. An application that you can add entries for expenses and incomes. How I started? Planning! I am planning the database. I intend to use PostgreSQL for my database. I am using dbdiagram.io to create my schemas dbdiagram.io On the left side I wrote in code what I want to represent in my tables.

item.title: Keychron Linux Function Keys
item.description: When I bought a Keychron K2 I knew it would work in Windows and Mac, but I use Linux. But itâ€™s just a keyboardâ€¦ it should work. Well… It works! But on my OS Arch Linux with Gnome had a little problem. The FN keys didnâ€™t work perfectly. Actually the FN keys were for MacOS, not Windows. How I fixed: Use the switch on side of keyboard to change to Windows mode Hold Fn + X + L for 4 seconds to set the key row to Function mode Type in the terminal:

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: Hello, friend. How are you? I’m fine and I expect that you are fine too. So… this is my blog! ðŸŽ‰ðŸŽ‰ðŸŽ‰ Yep! You are in it. I hope that you will have good moments and nice readings here. About what I’ll write? Hmmm… about everything, I think. You can hope to find subjects about technologies, histories from how I learn something. Example: sometimes I have a trouble in my Linux and I search all over the internet to find a solution.
